intro: Burmeistera quimiensis, commonly known as the Quimiensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody at the base. Burmeistera quimiensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
